resources.string:
This game is based from cellular automaton devised by John Horton Conway in 1970.

 Grid shows cells that can reproduce or die.
 - A cell dies if it has less than 2 or more than 3 adjacent neighbors. The dead cells are black.
 - A cell born in an empty box if it has exactly 3 neighbors. New cells are red.

 You can either play alone with green cells or cells play against purple.

 Virus are available to act on the life cycle of the grid cells. A virus can:
 - Kill cells,
 - Boost births cells,
 - Freeze cells.
 A virus has a life cycle and a radius of propagation.

 Game settings:
 - Density: population density of the initial grid (1 sparsely populated, 10 overcrowded).
 - Delay: display time in ms of each cycle.
 - Difficulty: number of viruses available.
 - Game mode: step by step or automatic.
